instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

threads.title: 820-3435 no backlight
threads.message:
Turns on but no backlight. Backlight fuse keeps getting shorted. Replaced fuse, Q7706 and Q7007 at same time but same thing happens.

Should U7701 be replaced next?

threads.title: 820-3435 no backlight
threads.message:
Did you check for short, or improper low value, on backlight rail before applying power?
Check w/ and w/o LCD connected; starting from fuse to LCD connector.

threads.title: 820-3435 no backlight
threads.message: Why didn't you check for a short...lol. Check for short with and without LCD connected as 2informaticos suggested on BKLT output.

threads.title: 820-3435 no backlight
threads.message:
.572 without LCD and 0.0001 with LCD.

Bad LCD?

threads.title: 820-3435 no backlight
threads.message: Either bad LCD connector on the board, bad LCD cable or bad LCD itself.

threads.title: 820-3435 no backlight
threads.message: Found  known good LCD to test with and short is gone but still no backlight. Replaced F7701 again but only 8.5V on PPVIN_S0SW_LCDBKLFET. Bad U7701? Board is spotless

threads.title: 820-3435 no backlight
threads.message:
Are you sure to get compatible screen?
Do you get image?
